name: Do you hear blowing of darkness?
description:
On my little night, alas
The wind vows with the leaves of trees
On my little night I am terrified of destruction
listen
Do you hear blowing of darkness?
I look at this happiness strangely
I am addicted to my despair
listen
Do you hear blowing of darkness?
Something happens the next night
The moon is red and confused
And on the roof where the disease is collapsing in every moment
Clouds, like crowds of mourners
It is as if they are waiting for the moment of rain
Moment moment
And then, nothing.
The night is shaking behind this window
The earth is staying out of rotation
Behind this window is an unknown
Worry about me and you
Hey, green cap-a-pie
Put the handout in my lover's hands as a burning special memory
And your lips like a warm feeling of being
Leave it to the caresses of my lover's lips
The wind will carry us with itself
The wind will carry us with itself

Poem: Forugh Farrokhzad (1934-1967)
Title of poem: The wind will carry us with itself
